name: https://images.vivino.com/thumbs/AlJU_NEET5SJ1shXdo2dcg_pb_x600.png
compareFoods:
Château Angelus
Le Carillon d’Angélus Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2016
Winery: [['Winery', 'Château Angelus'], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Saint-Émilion', 'Saint-Émilion Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Émilion'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wine's specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."]]

As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

Cos d'Estournel

As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Cos d'Estournel 2015
Winery: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

compareFoods:
Château La Fleur-Pétrus
Pomerol 2006
Winery: [['Winery', 'Château La Fleur-Pétrus'], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.']]

compareFoods:

Pomerol 2011
Winery: [['Winery', "Château l'Évangile"], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '14.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Wine description', 'Deep, dark colour with hints of violet. Very fruity nose with dark berries (Morello cherries, blackcurrants) and fresh notes of mocha and toast. On the palate, the attack is refined and silky, with a powerful, balanced tannic structure. The texture is dense and very velvety thanks to the ripe, well-coated tannins. The finish is long with fruity notes, but is dominated by the quality of the tannins.']]

Winery: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '12.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name: https://images.vivino.com/thumbs/AlJU_NEET5SJ1shXdo2dcg_pb_x600.png
compareFoods:
Château Angelus
Le Carillon d’Angélus Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2012
Winery: [['Winery', 'Château Angelus'], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Saint-Émilion', 'Saint-Émilion Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Émilion'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wine's specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."]]

Winery: [['Winery', 'Domaine Taupenot-Merme'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Gevrey-Chambertin', 'Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The displays kirsch as well as candied cherry on the nose, which are allied to (or is that pitted against?) tart rhubarb on a bright, firm palate. This is suffused with both chalky and invigoratingly saline mineral manifestations; rose hip, cherry pit, and smoky black tea adding further, piquant complexity that follows into a long, lip-smacking finish. An extreme expression of its cru, it will strike some tasters as too lean, tart, and bitter, but I find it not quite too much of the above three and tonic-like in its fascination and vivacity']]

Described as ‘bold, beautiful and elegant’ by the Vivino community, this wine is dry in style, with notes of red fruit, mushroom, leather and oak, with a slightly tannic aftertaste. Its complex profile makes it an excellent choice for those who are well versed in wine drinking and a fan of big, bold flavors.', '', 'If this is your wine of choice for your next dinner party, our community wine lovers it is best paired with beef, veal , game or poultry, making it ideal if you’re looking to serve up some hearty, meat-heavy dishes, but maybe one to avoid opening during light lunches with friends. ', '', "Château de Pommard Clos Marey-Monge Monopoles 2010 vintage was the winner of Vivino's 2020 Wine Style Awards: Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red, while it’s 2019 vintage ranks in the top 25 Burgundy Côte de Beaune red wines in the United States Right now. ', '', "Boasting notes of red fruit, as well as oaky and earthy flavors such as chocolate, leather and mushroom, the profile of Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' pairs extremely well with beef, veal, game and poultry. A very long and mouth watering finish. Drinks particularly well now, but will benefit from a few more years in the bottle.']]
